Positive: A 26-year-old male presents with a history of a sudden twist in the knee while playing soccer. He reports severe pain, swelling, and limited range of motion in the affected knee. Physical examination reveals instability in the knee joint and a positive anterior drawer test. MRI confirms a torn anterior cruciate ligament (ACL). The patient is diagnosed with an ACL injury.
Negative: A 45-year-old female presents with gradual onset knee pain and stiffness with no history of trauma. She does not report swelling or instability in the knee joint. Physical examination does not reveal any signs of ligamentous injury, and MRI shows no evidence of an ACL tear. The patient is negative for an ACL injury.
